00001 /* 
00002  * jcom.hub - autodoc
00003  * Generate HTML documentation for the jcom.hub external
00004  * By Tim Place & Trond Lossius, Copyright © 2006

00010 #include "jcom.hub.h"
00011 
00012 
00013 void hub_autodoc(t_hub *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00014 {
00015         t_symbol *userpath = _sym_nothing;
00016         
00017         if(argc)
00018                 userpath = atom_getsym(argv);
00019         defer_low(x, (method)hub_doautodoc, userpath, 0, 0L);
00020 }
00021 
00022 
00023 void hub_doautodoc(t_hub *x, t_symbol *userpath)
00024 {
00025         long                    type = 'TEXT';                          // four-char code for Mac file type
00026         char                    filename[256];                          // for storing the name of the file locally
00027         short                   path, err;                                      // pathID#, error number
00028         long                    outtype;                                        // the file type that is actually true
00029         t_filehandle    file_handle;                            // a reference to our file (for opening it, closing it, etc.)
00030         long                    myEof = 0;
00031         char                    tempstring[1024];
00032         subscriberList  *subscriber = x->subscriber;    // the head of the linked list
00033         long                    argc;
00034         t_atom                  a[2];
00035         t_atom                  *argv = &a[0];
00036         t_symbol                *result;
00037         t_symbol                *msg_type;
00038         //long                  num_signals;
00039         float                   range[2];
00040 
00041         // SPECIFY THE FILE WE WANT TO WRITE
00042         if(!userpath->s_name[0]){                                                                                               // Empty string - Throw up a dialog
00043                 sprintf(filename, "%s.html", x->attr_name->s_name);                                     // Default File Name
00044                 saveas_promptset("Save Generated HTML Documentation...");                       // Instructional Text in the dialog
00045                 err = saveasdialog_extended(filename, &path, &outtype, &type, 1);       // Returns 0 if successful
00046                 if(err)                                                                                                                         // User Cancelled
00047                         return;                                                                                                                 
00048         }
00049         else{
00050                 strcpy(filename, userpath->s_name);                                                                     // Copy symbol argument to a local string
00051                 path = 0;               
00052         }
00053 
00054         // NOW ATTEMPT TO CREATE THE FILE...
00055         err = path_createsysfile(filename, path, type, &file_handle);
00056         if(err){                                                                                                                                // Handle any errors that occur
00057                 error("jcom.hub: %s - error %d creating file", filename, err);
00058                 return; 
00059         }
00060 
00061         // HERE WE CAN FINALLY WRITE THE DATA OUT TO THE FILE
00062         
00063         // html header
00064         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN\">");    
00065         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "<html>");
00066         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<head>");
00067         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t\t<meta http-equiv=\"content-type\" content=\"text/html;charset=ISO-8859-1\">");
00068         sprintf(tempstring, "<title> %s </title>", x->attr_name->s_name);       
00069         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00070 //      jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t\t<link href=\"../../../documentation/html/styles/jamoma.css\" rel=\"stylesheet\" type=\"text/css\">");       
00071         hub_autodoc_css(&file_handle, &myEof);
00072         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t</head>");
00073         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "");
00074 
00075         // html body
00076         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "<body>");
00077         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<div id=\"jmod_header\">");
00078 
00079         // Top of page displaying name of module etc.
00080         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<img src=\"../../../documentation/images/jmod.icon.mod.png\" width=\"128\" height=\"128\">"); 
00081         sprintf(tempstring, "\t<h1> %s </h1>", x->attr_name->s_name);
00082         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00083         sprintf(tempstring, "\t<h2> %s </h2>", x->attr_description->s_name);
00084         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00085 
00086         // Menu
00087         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<h6><a href=\"../../../documentation/html/index.html\">Table of Contents</a> | <a href=\"../modules/\">Index of Modules</a> | <a href=\"http://jamoma.org/\">Jamoma.org</a></h6>");
00088         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t</div>");
00089         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "");
00090                 
00091         // Configuration
00092         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<h3> Configuration </h3>");
00093         sprintf(tempstring, "\t<p> Module Type: <code> %s </code> <br>", x->attr_type->s_name);
00094         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00095         sprintf(tempstring, "\tAlgorithm Type: <code> %s </code> </p>", x->attr_algorithm_type->s_name);
00096         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);             
00097         sprintf(tempstring, "\t<p>Interface Size: <code> %s </code> </p>", x->attr_size->s_name);
00098         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00099         
00100         // Inlets and outlets
00101         if(x->in_object){
00102                 argc = NULL;
00103                 argv = NULL;
00104                 object_attr_getvalueof(x->in_object, ps_num_inputs, &argc, &argv);      
00105                 sprintf(tempstring, "\t<p>Number of signal inlets: <code> %ld </ code> <br/>", atom_getlong(argv));
00106                 jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00107         }
00108         else
00109                 jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<p>BOGUS INLET DEFINITION!<br/>");
00110 
00111         if(x->out_object){      // jcom.out is optional in the case of no signals
00112                 argc = NULL;
00113                 argv = NULL;
00114                 object_attr_getvalueof(x->out_object, ps_num_outputs, &argc, &argv);
00115                 sprintf(tempstring, "\tNumber of signal outlets: <code> %ld </code> </p>", atom_getlong(argv));
00116                 jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00117         }       
00118         else{
00119                 jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "Number of signal outlets: <code> 0 </code> </p>");
00120         }
00121         
00122 
00124         //
00125         // Parameters
00126         //
00128 
00129         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<h3> Parameters </h3>");      
00130         table_heading(&file_handle, &myEof);
00131 
00132         // Process each parameter
00133         critical_enter(0);
00134         subscriber = x->subscriber;
00135         subscriberIterator i;
00136         t_subscriber* t;
00137         for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00138                 t = *i;
00139                 if(t->type == ps_subscribe_parameter){
00140                         // name
00141                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t\t<tr>");     
00142                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class=\"instructionName\"> %s </td>", t->name->s_name);
00143                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00144                         
00145                         // type
00146                         argc = NULL;
00147                         argv = NULL;
00148                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_type , &argc, &argv);
00149                         msg_type = atom_getsym(argv);
00150                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionType\"> %s </td>", msg_type->s_name);
00151                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00152                         
00153                         // range
00154                         argc = NULL;
00155                         argv = NULL;
00156                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object, ps_range, &argc, &argv);
00157                         range[0] = atom_getfloat(argv);
00158                         range[1] = atom_getfloat(argv+1);
00159                         if( (msg_type==ps_msg_int) || (msg_type==ps_msg_toggle) )
00160                                 sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRange\"> %ld %ld </td>", (long)range[0], (long)range[1]);
00161                         else if ( (msg_type==ps_msg_float) || (msg_type==ps_msg_generic) )
00162                                 sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRange\"> %f %f </td>", range[0], range[1]);
00163                         else
00164                                 sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<th class = \"instructionRange\"> N/A </td>");
00165                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);     
00166                                                         
00167                         // clipmode
00168                         argc = NULL;
00169                         argv = NULL;
00170                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_clipmode , &argc, &argv);
00171                         result = atom_getsym(argv);
00172                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionClipmode\"> %s </td>", result->s_name);
00173                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00174                                 
00175                         // ramp
00176                         argc = NULL;
00177                         argv = NULL;
00178                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object, ps_ramp_drive, &argc, &argv);
00179                         result = atom_getsym(argv);
00180                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRamp\"> %s </td>", result->s_name);
00181                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00182                                 
00183                         // repetitions
00184                         argc = NULL;
00185                         argv = NULL;
00186                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_repetitions , &argc, &argv);
00187                         
00188                         //result = atom_getlong(argv);
00189                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRepetitions\"> %ld </td>", atom_getlong(argv));
00190                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00191                         
00192                         // description
00193                         argc = NULL;
00194                         argv = NULL;
00195                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_description , &argc, &argv);
00196                         result = atom_getsym(argv);
00197                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionDescription\"> %s </td>", result->s_name);
00198                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00199                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t\t<tr>");
00200                 }
00201         }       
00202         critical_exit(0);
00203         
00204         // End of table
00205         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t</table>");
00206         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "");
00207         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<p>&nbsp;</p>");
00208         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "");
00209 
00211         //
00212         // Messages
00213         //
00215 
00216         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<h3> Messages </h3>");        
00217         table_heading(&file_handle, &myEof);
00218                 
00219         // Process each message
00220         critical_enter(0);
00221         for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00222                 t = *i;
00223                 if(t->type == ps_subscribe_message){
00224                         // name
00225                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t\t<tr>");     
00226                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class=\"instructionName\"> %s </td>", t->name->s_name);
00227                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00228                         
00229                         // type
00230                         argc = NULL;
00231                         argv = NULL;
00232                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_type , &argc, &argv);
00233                         msg_type = atom_getsym(argv);
00234                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionType\"> %s </td>", msg_type->s_name);
00235                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00236                         
00237                         // range
00238                         argc = NULL;
00239                         argv = NULL;
00240                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object, ps_range, &argc, &argv);
00241                         range[0] = atom_getfloat(argv);
00242                         range[1] = atom_getfloat(argv+1);
00243                         if( (msg_type==ps_msg_int) || (msg_type==ps_msg_toggle) )
00244                                 sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRange\"> %ld %ld </td>", (long)range[0], (long)range[1]);
00245                         else if ( (msg_type==ps_msg_float) || (msg_type==ps_msg_generic) )
00246                                 sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRange\"> %f %f </td>", range[0], range[1]);
00247                         else
00248                                 sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<th class = \"instructionRange\"> N/A </td>");
00249                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);     
00250                                                         
00251                         // clipmode
00252                         argc = NULL;
00253                         argv = NULL;
00254                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_clipmode , &argc, &argv);
00255                         result = atom_getsym(argv);
00256                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionClipmode\"> %s </td>", result->s_name);
00257                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00258                                 
00259                         // ramp
00260                         argc = NULL;
00261                         argv = NULL;
00262                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object, ps_ramp_drive, &argc, &argv);
00263                         result = atom_getsym(argv);
00264                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRamp\"> %s </td>", result->s_name);
00265                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00266                                 
00267                         // repetitions
00268                         argc = NULL;
00269                         argv = NULL;
00270                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_repetitions , &argc, &argv);
00271                         
00272                         //result = atom_getlong(argv);
00273                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRepetitions\"> %ld </td>", atom_getlong(argv));
00274                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00275                         
00276                         // description
00277                         argc = NULL;
00278                         argv = NULL;
00279                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_description , &argc, &argv);
00280                         result = atom_getsym(argv);
00281                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionDescription\"> %s </td>", result->s_name);
00282                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00283                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t\t<tr>");
00284                 }
00285         }
00286         critical_exit(0);
00287         
00288         // End of table
00289         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t</table>");
00290         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "");
00291         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<p>&nbsp;</p>");
00292         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "");
00293 
00295         //
00296         // Return
00297         //
00299 
00300         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<h3> Return </h3>");  
00301         table_heading(&file_handle, &myEof);
00302                 
00303         // Process each return
00304         critical_enter(0);
00305         for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00306                 t = *i;
00307                 if(t->type == ps_subscribe_return){
00308                         // name
00309                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t\t<tr>");     
00310                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class=\"instructionName\"> %s </td>", t->name->s_name);
00311                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00312                         
00313                         // type
00314                         argc = NULL;
00315                         argv = NULL;
00316                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_type , &argc, &argv);
00317                         msg_type = atom_getsym(argv);
00318                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionType\"> %s </td>", msg_type->s_name);
00319                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00320                         
00321                         // range
00322                         argc = NULL;
00323                         argv = NULL;
00324                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object, ps_range, &argc, &argv);
00325                         range[0] = atom_getfloat(argv);
00326                         range[1] = atom_getfloat(argv+1);
00327                         if( (msg_type==ps_msg_int) || (msg_type==ps_msg_toggle) )
00328                                 sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRange\"> %ld %ld </td>", (long)range[0], (long)range[1]);
00329                         else if ( (msg_type==ps_msg_float) || (msg_type==ps_msg_generic) )
00330                                 sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRange\"> %f %f </td>", range[0], range[1]);
00331                         else
00332                                 sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<th class = \"instructionRange\"> N/A </td>");
00333                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);     
00334                                                         
00335                         // clipmode
00336                         argc = NULL;
00337                         argv = NULL;
00338                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_clipmode , &argc, &argv);
00339                         result = atom_getsym(argv);
00340                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionClipmode\"> %s </td>", result->s_name);
00341                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00342                                 
00343                         // ramp
00344                         argc = NULL;
00345                         argv = NULL;
00346                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object, ps_ramp_drive, &argc, &argv);
00347                         result = atom_getsym(argv);
00348                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRamp\"> %s </td>", result->s_name);
00349                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00350                                 
00351                         // repetitions
00352                         argc = NULL;
00353                         argv = NULL;
00354                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_repetitions , &argc, &argv);
00355                         
00356                         //result = atom_getlong(argv);
00357                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionRepetitions\"> %ld </td>", atom_getlong(argv));
00358                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00359                         
00360                         // description
00361                         argc = NULL;
00362                         argv = NULL;
00363                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object ,ps_description , &argc, &argv);
00364                         result = atom_getsym(argv);
00365                         sprintf(tempstring, "\t\t\t<td class =\"instructionDescription\"> %s </td>", result->s_name);
00366                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, tempstring);
00367                         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t\t<tr>");
00368                 }
00369 
00370         }
00371         critical_exit(0);
00372         
00373         // End of table
00374         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t</table>");
00375         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "");
00376         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<p>&nbsp;</p>");
00377         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "");
00378         
00379         // Some final info on Jamoma
00380         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<h3> About Jamoma </h3>");            
00381         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\t<p> Jamoma is a system for creating and exchanging structured Max patches. ");
00382         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\tIt consists of both a set of guidelines and an implementation of those guidelines. ");
00383         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "\tFor more information please visit <a href=\"http://jamoma.org/\">jamoma.org</a>. </p> ");
00384 
00385         // End of page
00386         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "</body>");
00387         jcom_core_file_writeline(&file_handle, &myEof, "</html>");
00388         
00389         
00390         // WE ARE DONE, SO CLOSE THE FILE
00391         err = sysfile_seteof(file_handle, myEof);
00392         if(err){
00393                 error("jcom.hub: %s - error %d creating EOF", filename, err);
00394                 return; 
00395         }
00396                                                         
00397         sysfile_close(file_handle);             // close file reference
00398         
00399         atom_setsym(&a[0], ps_done);
00400         hub_outlet_return(x, gensym("/documentation/generate"), 1, &a[0]);
00401 }
00402 
00403 //      Generates table heading for parameters and messages
00404 void table_heading(t_filehandle *file_handle, long *myEof)
00405 {               
00406         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "\t<table>");
00407         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "\t\t<tr class=\"tableHeading2\">");
00408         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "\t\t\t<td> Name </td>");
00409         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "\t\t\t<td> Type </td>");
00410         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "\t\t\t<td> Range </td>");
00411         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "\t\t\t<td> Clipmode </td>");
00412         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "\t\t\t<td> Ramp Enabled </td>");
00413         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "\t\t\t<td> Repetitions </td>");   
00414         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "\t\t\t<td> Description </td>");
00415         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "\t\t<tr>");
00416 }

00418 
00419 // CSS definitions -- we include them in the html file itself so that we don't have problems with paths to external references
00420 void hub_autodoc_css(t_filehandle *file_handle, long *myEof)
00421 {
00422         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "<style type=\"text/css\">");
00423 
00424         jcom_core_file_writeline(file_handle, myEof, "\
00425 body {\
00426         margin: 0px;\
00427         font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;\
00428 }\
00429 \
00430 h1 {\
00431         font-size: 24px;\
00432         font-weight:100;\
00433         padding-top: 1em;\
00434         margin: 0;\
00435 }\
00436 \
00437 \
00438 h2 {\
00439         font-size: 18px;\
00440         font-weight:200;\
00441         margin: 0;\
00442         color: #555;\
00443         text-transform: lowercase;\
00444 }\
00445 \
00446 h3 {\
00447         color: #888;\
00448         border-bottom: 1px solid #333;\
00449         font-size: 18px;\
00450         font-weight:100;\
00451         margin-top: 20px;\
00452         margin-bottom: 10px;\
00453         margin-left: 2%;\
00454         margin-right: 2%;\
00455 }\
00456 \
00457 h4{\
00458         color: #333;\
00459         font-size: 14px;\
